dta.Demand¶

class Demand(net, vehClassName, startTime, endTime, timeStep)¶

Bases: object

Class that represents the demand matrix for a Network

Constructor that initializes an empty Demand table that has three dimensions: time, origin taz, destination taz.

Parameters:
  • net (a Network instance) – the Network for which this demand is relevant, used to get TAZ numbers.
  • vehClassName – a string that must match the relevant VehicleClass exactly (it’s case-sensitive!)
  • startTime (a dta.Utils.Time instance) – the simulation start time for when this demand will get added to the network.
  • endTime (a dta.Utils.Time instance) – the simulation end time for this demand will stop being added to the network.
  • timeStep (a dta.Utils.Time instance) – the granularity of time steps at which the demand is represented.
__init__(net, vehClassName, startTime, endTime, timeStep)¶

Constructor that initializes an empty Demand table that has three dimensions: time, origin taz, destination taz.

Parameters:
  • net (a Network instance) – the Network for which this demand is relevant, used to get TAZ numbers.
  • vehClassName – a string that must match the relevant VehicleClass exactly (it’s case-sensitive!)
  • startTime (a dta.Utils.Time instance) – the simulation start time for when this demand will get added to the network.
  • endTime (a dta.Utils.Time instance) – the simulation end time for this demand will stop being added to the network.
  • timeStep (a dta.Utils.Time instance) – the granularity of time steps at which the demand is represented.

_getTimePeriods(startTime, endTime, timeStep)¶

Return the time labels of the different time slices as a list of dta.Utils.Time instances. Each time in the list is the end of the time slice.

_timeInMin(time)¶

Return input time in minutes. Input time should be a datetime.datetime or datetime.timedelta object

applyTimeOfDayFactors(factorsInAList)¶

Apply the given time of day factors to the existing demand object and return a new demand object with as many time slices as the number of factors. Each time slice is the result of the original table multiplied by a factor in the list.

getNumSlices()¶

Return the number of time slices the demand has been split

getTotalNumTrips()¶

Return the total number of trips for all time periods

getValue(timeLabel, origin, destination)¶

Return the value of the given time period, origin, and destination

iterTimePeriods()¶

Return an iterator to the time periods associated with the demand time slices

classmethod readCubeODTable(fileName, net, vehicleClassName, startTime, endTime, timeStep, demandPortion)¶

Reads the demand (linear format) from the input csv file and returns a demand instance.

Parameters:
  • fileName – the file containing the demand; this will be a CSV containing Origin, Destination, VehicleClassDemand1, VehicleClassDemand2, .... The header line will be used to determine which column is relevant to which Vehicle Class.
  • net (a Network instance) – the Network for which this demand is relevant, used to get TAZ numbers.
  • vehClassName – a string that must match the relevant VehicleClass exactly (it’s case-sensitive!)
  • startTime (a dta.Utils.Time instance) – the simulation start time for when this demand will get added to the network.
  • endTime (a dta.Utils.Time instance) – the simulation end time for this demand will stop being added to the network.
  • timeStep (a dta.Utils.Time instance) – the granularity of time steps at which the demand is represented.
classmethod readDynameqTable(net, fileName)¶

Read the dynameq demand stored in the fileName that pertains to net, a Network instance. This method reads only rectangular demand tables.

removeInvalidODPairs()¶

Examine all the OD interchanges and remove those for which a path does not exist from origin to destination

setValue(timeLabel, origin, destination, value)¶

Set the value of the given timeLabel, origin, and destination

classmethod writeDynameqDemandHeader(outputStream, startTime, endTime, vehClassName, format='full')¶

Write the demand in Dynameq format .. todo:: implement linear writing
